intro: Dactylorhiza viridis, commonly known as the green orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and heathlands. The plant has a slender, upright stem with several oval, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are greenish-yellow and are arranged in a raceme, often with a faintly fragrant scent. Dactylorhiza viridis is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
